thread.title: Florence + the Machine ready to roll over KeyArena
thread.title_full: Florence + the Machine ready to roll over KeyArena | The Seattle Times

author: OWEN R. SMITH
title: Florence + the Machine ready to roll over KeyArena
text:
It makes sense that Florence + the Machine will play at KeyArena when the band visits Seattle on Tuesday (Oct. 27). With her flamethrower voice, lead singer Florence Welch will have no problem filling that cavernous room.
It also makes sense because plenty of people are going to snatch up tickets. The group’s 2015 album “How Big, How Blue, How Beautiful” was its first to hit No. 1 on the U.S. Billboard 200, and lead single “Ship To Wreck” cracked the top 10 in Billboard’s rock airplay, alternative and adult alternative categories.
Call Florence + the Machine an “indie rock band” if you must, but don’t let those Billboard charts fool you — this is pop music, smartly designed and executed with the professional gloss that often comes by the time a band reaches its third album. Thrumming brass arranged by Goldfrapp’s Will Gregory (a fellow Brit) pushes the bouncing pop of “Queen of Peace” forward, and makes quiet moments like the one found on “St. Jude” even more effective.
On that song, Welch ponders whether she has “always been more comfortable in chaos.” Perhaps it’s true, but for Welch and her band, the chaos clearly remains contained within.
